result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L Marvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of a Controlled Substance-THC. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.

The defendant must undergo anger management assessment and follow thru with all recommendations. 

The defendant must pursue medical evaluations and keep any appointments with the doctor and take any and all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed. 

The defendant must participate in family counseling that is currently in place.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian L Marvin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: From defendant in regards to AODA & Anger management. Ex parte letter sent to defendant.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian L Marvin
Current: 2155 Military Rd, Eagle River, WI 54521 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2015)
Prior: 10052 Airport Road, Crandon, WI 54520
amended state's settlement recommendation

Called at 3:31 PM. Brian Marvin appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. State - have complied with victim notification requirements and she is in the courtroom today - matter is resolved - plead G to counts #2, #3 and #4 as alleged, #1 - DRI, joint recommendation court costs on #2 and #3 and 2 year probation on each of those counts, #4 - $300 fine plus costs and surchareges and no probation, conditions are: AODA, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns. Marvin and Roley agree. Court - #1 - DRI. Marvin pleads G to counts #2, #3 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Roley makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Marvin makes statement, has already enrolled in AODA and anger management. Victims makes statement. Court now makes count #4 a county ordinance of possession of THC, vacate previous finding of G and plea, pleads G to amended count, pleasd G, finds G, fine of $100.00 plus costs totalling $330.50 - take bond posted. Court sentences the defendant to the following:  counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for2 years with conditions of: costs on each count plus DA abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge on one count - take bond posted and remainder paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, pursuit medical evaluations and keep any appointments with the doctor and take any and all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, participate in family counseling that is currently in place, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, right to appeal, adjourned.
Ex Parte Letter - JA sent copy to counsel.

certificate of appearance-AW
Jury trial on August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian L Marvin in court with attorney Thomas C Roley.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:15 pm Not resolved set for JT. State has complied with victim notification. Court advises of not accepting offer and going to trial. State advises that offer involved getting rid of the felony. Roley has explained the Frye case and will proceed to trial. Bond continued  Jury trial scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on July 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Called at 12:01 PM. Brian Marvin appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. State - believe it will be waived and have filed Information in anticipation of that. Roley and Marvin agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Roley has Information that mirrors complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set for FPT on 7/2/14 at 10:00 AM.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: approved - $200.00/month commencing 6/1/14
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Danielle Marvin.
Preliminary hearing on May 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 9:19 AM. Brian Marvin appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. State - also has 14CM50 - asked that this case also be called today for stated reasons. Court calls 14CM50. Marvin informs Court that he did not have the money to hire an attorney, has not contacted SPD. Burns - does not qualify for SPD. Court - given paperwork previously to fill out court appointed attorney forms - asks why he did not complete those forms. Marvin - will fill out paperwork after Court. Court recess to fill out court appointed paperwork. Recalled at 9:53 AM. Court reviews paperwork and will appoint Thomas Roley, payable at $200.00/month commencing 6/1/14. Recess to talk to attorney. Recalled at 10:07 AM. Roley has reviewed both complaints, waives further reading, pleads NG to all counts on 14CM50 and requests PH on 14CF47, will waive time limits for that. Roley - ask for reduction in cash bond on 14CF47 to $500 for stated reasons - also want to address the no-contact provision on the bond. State - bond- no objections to a reduction in bond to $500.00 cash but makes statement regarding their toxic relationship. Court continues bond on 14CM50 - reduces bond to $500 cash on 14CF47 with same conditions - refund remainder to be applied to court appointed attorney account - informs of process to get that no contact provision lifted, accepts NG pleas on 14CM50, set 14CM50 for FPT on 7/2/14 at 1:15 PM, considers time limits waived for PH on 14CM47 - on 5/21/14 at 3:00 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 9:43 AM. Brian Marvin appears in person and without counsel. State appears by JBC. Marvin has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Marvin understands charges, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own. Court gives court appointed paperwork in Court. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 5/7/14 at 9:00 AM. Defendant will try and get an attorney for next week. Court informs on the procedure to get the no-contact provision lifted, State not willing to lift that condition due to seriousness of the offense.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Danielle Marvin.
Cash bond set.
